title: Authors and Citation
text: Wilson Freitas. Maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Freitas W (2023). rbcb: R Interface Brazilian Central Bank Web Services. https://github.com/wilsonfreitas/rbcb, https://wilsonfreitas.github.io/rbcb/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {rbcb: R Interface to Brazilian Central Bank Web Services},   author = {Wilson Freitas},   year = {2023},   note = {https://github.com/wilsonfreitas/rbcb, https://wilsonfreitas.github.io/rbcb/}, }

what: R Interface to Brazilian Central Bank Web Services
title: R Interface to Brazilian Central Bank Web Services
text: interface structure information provided Brazilian Central Bank. package interfaces Brazilian Central Bank web services provide data already formatted R’s data structures.

title: R Interface to Brazilian Central Bank Web Services
text: CRAN: github using remotes:
code: install.packages("rbcb") remotes::install_github('wilsonfreitas/rbcb')

title: R Interface to Brazilian Central Bank Web Services
text: Install get_series function Market expectations OLINDA API currency rates Currency rates Cross currency rates

title: R Interface to Brazilian Central Bank Web Services
text: Load package:
code: library(rbcb)

title: R Interface to Brazilian Central Bank Web Services
text: Download series calling rbcb::get_series pass time series code first argument. example, let’s download USDBRL time series code 1. Note series starts 1984 approximately 8000 rows. Also note can name downloaded series passing named vector code argument. download recent values use argument last = N, see .  series can downloaded many different types: tibble, xts, ts data.frame, default tibble. See next example Brazilian Broad Consumer Price Index (IPCA) downloaded xts object.  ts object.  Multiple series can downloaded passing named vector series codes. return named list downloaded series.

title: R Interface to Brazilian Central Bank Web Services
text: function get_market_expectations returns market expectations discussed Focus Report summarizes statistics calculated expectations collected market practitioners. first argument type accepts following values: annual: annual expectations quarterly: quarterly expectations monthly: monthly expectations top5s-monthly: monthly expectations top 5 indicators top5s-annual: annual expectations top 5 indicators inflation-12-months: inflation expectations next 12 months institutions: market expectations informed financial institutions example shows download IPCA’s monthly expectations.
code: rbcb::get_market_expectations("monthly", "IPCA", end_date = "2018-01-31", `$top` = 5) #> # A tibble: 5 x 10 #>   Indicador Data       DataReferencia Media Mediana DesvioPadrao Minimo Maximo numeroRespondentes baseCalculo #>   <chr>     <date>     <chr>          <dbl>   <dbl>        <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>              <int>       <int> #> 1 IPCA      2018-01-31 06/2019         0.21    0.2          0.07   0.13   0.36                 14           1 #> 2 IPCA      2018-01-31 06/2019         0.2     0.2          0.1   -0.3    0.36                 43           0 #> 3 IPCA      2018-01-31 05/2019         0.31    0.29         0.06   0.22   0.43                 19           1 #> 4 IPCA      2018-01-31 05/2019         0.31    0.3          0.06   0.15   0.45                 55           0 #> 5 IPCA      2018-01-31 04/2019         0.38    0.39         0.1    0.16   0.61                 20           1

title: R Interface to Brazilian Central Bank Web Services
text: Use currency functions download currency rates BCB OLINDA API. Use olinda_get_currency function download data specific currency currency symbol. rates come quoted BRL, 3.10 worth 1 USD BRL. Parity values Type currencies parity values quoted USD (1 CURRENCY USD). Type B currencies parity values 1 USD CURRENCY, see AUD, example.

title: R Interface to Brazilian Central Bank Web Services
text: Use currency functions download currency rates BCB web site. rates come quoted BRL, 3.0970 worth 1 USD BRL. currency time series attribute called symbol stores currency name. Trying another currency. see avaliable currencies call list_currencies. 216 currencies available.
code: rbcb::get_currency("USD", "2017-03-01", "2017-03-10") #> # A tibble: 8 x 3 #>   date         bid   ask #>   <date>     <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 2017-03-01  3.10  3.10 #> 2 2017-03-02  3.11  3.11 #> 3 2017-03-03  3.14  3.14 #> 4 2017-03-06  3.11  3.11 #> 5 2017-03-07  3.12  3.12 #> 6 2017-03-08  3.15  3.15 #> 7 2017-03-09  3.17  3.17 #> 8 2017-03-10  3.16  3.16 attr(rbcb::get_currency("USD", "2017-03-01", "2017-03-10"), "symbol") #> [1] "USD" get_currency("JPY", "2017-03-01", "2017-03-10") |> Ask() #> # A tibble: 8 x 2 #>   date          JPY #>   <date>      <dbl> #> 1 2017-03-01 0.0273 #> 2 2017-03-02 0.0272 #> 3 2017-03-03 0.0274 #> 4 2017-03-06 0.0274 #> 5 2017-03-07 0.0274 #> 6 2017-03-08 0.0274 #> 7 2017-03-09 0.0276 #> 8 2017-03-10 0.0275 rbcb::list_currencies() #> # A tibble: 218 x 5 #>    name                   code symbol country_name          country_code #>    <chr>                 <dbl> <chr>  <chr>                        <dbl> #>  1 AFEGANE AFEGANIST         5 AFN    AFEGANISTAO                    132 #>  2 RANDE/AFRICA SUL        785 ZAR    AFRICA DO SUL                 7560 #>  3 LEK ALBANIA REP         490 ALL    ALBANIA, REPUBLICA DA          175 #>  4 EURO                    978 EUR    ALEMANHA                       230 #>  5 KWANZA/ANGOLA           635 AOA    ANGOLA                         400 #>  6 DOLAR CARIBE ORIENTAL   215 XCD    ANGUILLA                       418 #>  7 DOLAR CARIBE ORIENTAL   215 XCD    ANTIGUA E BARBUDA              434 #>  8 RIAL/ARAB SAUDITA       820 SAR    ARABIA SAUDITA                 531 #>  9 DINAR ARGELINO           95 DZD    ARGELIA                        590 #> 10 PESO ARGENTINO          706 ARS    ARGENTINA                      639 #> # ... with 208 more rows

title: R Interface to Brazilian Central Bank Web Services
text: API provides matrix relations exchange rates, matrix cross currency rates. square matrix exchange rates currencies. rates quoted columns labels, numbers BRL column worth one currency unit BRL.
code: x <- rbcb::get_currency_cross_rates("2017-03-10") dim(x) #> [1] 156 156 # Since there are many currencies it is interesting to subset the matrix. cr <- c("USD", "BRL", "EUR", "CAD") x[cr, cr] #>           USD    BRL       EUR       CAD #> USD 1.0000000 3.1623 0.9380896 1.3465764 #> BRL 0.3162255 1.0000 0.2966479 0.4258218 #> EUR 1.0659963 3.3710 1.0000000 1.4354454 #> CAD 0.7426240 2.3484 0.6966479 1.0000000

title: All currency values — get_all_currencies
text: Gets currency values

title: All currency values — get_all_currencies
code: get_all_currencies(date)

title: All currency values — get_all_currencies
text: date reference date

title: All currency values — get_all_currencies
text: data.frame currency values given date. currency rates come quoted BRL.

title: All currency values — get_all_currencies
code: if (FALSE) { get_all_currencies("2017-03-10") }

what: Get annual market expectations of economic indicators — get_annual_market_expectations
title: Get annual market expectations of economic indicators — get_annual_market_expectations
text: Statistics annual expectations economic indicators. statistics computed based annual expectations provided many financial institutions Brazil: banks, funds, risk managers, forth. expections statistics used build FOCUS Report weekly released Brazilian Central Bank.

title: Get annual market expectations of economic indicators — get_annual_market_expectations
code: get_annual_market_expectations(   indic = NULL,   start_date = NULL,   end_date = NULL,   ... )

title: Get annual market expectations of economic indicators — get_annual_market_expectations
text: indic character vector economic indicators names. case sensitive forget accents. start_date series initial date. Accepts ISO character formated date Date. end_date series final date. Accepts ISO character formated date Date. ... additional parameters passed API indic argument must one indicators listed Details. Respecting case, blank spaces accents. ... used API's parameters. $top specify maximum number rows returned, returns $top rows, chronological order. also $skip ignore first rows.

title: Get annual market expectations of economic indicators — get_annual_market_expectations
text: data.frame requested data.

title: Get annual market expectations of economic indicators — get_annual_market_expectations
text: annual expectations available following indicators: Balança Comercial Câmbio Conta corrente Dívida bruta governo geral Dívida líquida setor público IGP-DI IGP-M INPC Investimento direto país IPA-DI IPA-M IPCA IPCA Administrados IPCA Alimentação domicílio IPCA Bens industrializados IPCA Livres IPCA Serviços IPCA-15 IPC-FIPE PIB Agropecuária PIB Despesa de consumo da administração pública PIB despesa de consumo das famílias PIB Exportação de bens e serviços PIB Formação Bruta de Capital Fixo PIB Importação de bens e serviços PIB Indústria PIB Serviços PIB Total Produção industrial Resultado nominal Resultado primário Selic Taxa de desocupação Check <https://olinda.bcb.gov.br/olinda/servico/Expectativas/versao/v1/documentacao#ExpectativasMercadoAnuais> details

title: Get annual market expectations of economic indicators — get_annual_market_expectations
code: if (FALSE) { indic <- c("PIB Total", "Fiscal") end_date <- "2018-01-31" x <- get_annual_market_expectations(indic, end_date = end_date, `$top` = 10)  # return all indicators for the specified date range start_date <- "2021-01-01" x <- get_annual_market_expectations(start_date = start_date, `$top` = 20) }

what: Get currency values for a given period — get_currency
title: Get currency values for a given period — get_currency
text: Given currency symbol time interval (dates) function returns bid ask time series currency rates.

title: Get currency values for a given period — get_currency
code: get_currency(   symbol,   start_date,   end_date,   as = c("tibble", "xts", "data.frame", "text") )

title: Get currency values for a given period — get_currency
text: symbol currency symbol start_date time interval initial date end_date time interval last date object's returning type symbol argument three digits character represents one currency. symbols can obtained list_currencies. time series date range defined start_date end_date.

title: Get currency values for a given period — get_currency
text: time series bid ask currency rates regarding given symbol quoted BRL. default returning tibble-fashioned data.frame three columns: date, ask bid. argument also accepts data.frame return old fashioned data frames, xts return xts object two variables (bid ask) text returns text content download BCB site.

title: Get currency values for a given period — get_currency

what: Get currency matrix from BCB — get_currency_cross_rates
title: Get currency matrix from BCB — get_currency_cross_rates
text: currency matrix currency cross rates currencies present BCB system.

title: Get currency matrix from BCB — get_currency_cross_rates
code: get_currency_cross_rates(date, ref = c("ask", "bid"))

title: Get currency matrix from BCB — get_currency_cross_rates
text: date reference date ref reffers bid ask rates (default ask) date reference date currency rates must downloaded. ref defaults ask bid returns currency cross rates calculated bid rates.

title: Get currency matrix from BCB — get_currency_cross_rates
text: square matrix colnames rownames filled currency symbols cells must read ROW COL, example, BRL (row) USD (column) means Brazilian Reals American Dollars.

title: Get currency matrix from BCB — get_currency_cross_rates
code: if (FALSE) { x <- get_currency_cross_rates("2017-03-10") currencies <- c("USD", "BRL", "AUD", "EUR", "CAD") x[currencies, currencies] }

title: Get market expectations — get_market_expectations
text: General function get statistics market expectations. API provides requests annual, monthly, quarterly expectations. also proveided expectations 12 months ahead, specific requests top 5 indicators annual monthly expectations data provided financial institutions.

title: Get market expectations — get_market_expectations
code: get_market_expectations(   type = c("annual", "quarterly", "monthly", "inflation-12-months", "top5s-monthly",     "top5s-annual", "selic", "top5s-selic"),   indic = NULL,   start_date = NULL,   end_date = NULL,   keep_names = TRUE,   ... )

title: Get market expectations — get_market_expectations
text: type character one following: annual, quarterly monthly, inflation-12-months, top5s-monthly, top5s-annual. indic character vector economic indicators names. case sensitive forget accents. start_date series initial date. Accepts ISO character formated date Date. end_date series final date. Accepts ISO character formated date Date. keep_names TRUE keeps column names returned API (portuguese), FALSE columns renamed standardized names (english). ... additional parameters passed API type defines API used fetch data. selic: refers API *Expectativas de Mercado Selic - Estatísticas* SELIC rate expectations annual: refers API *Expectativas de Mercado Anuais* annual market expectations quarterly: refers API *Expectativas de Mercado Trimestrais* quarterly market expectations monthly: refers API *Expectativas de Mercado Mensais* monthly market expectations inflation-12-months: refers API *Expectativas de mercado para inflação nos próximos 12 meses* market expectations inflation indexes next 12 months. top5s-selic: refers API *Expectativas de Mercado Selic Top5* SELIC rate expectations top 5's top5s-monthly: refers API *Expectativas de mercado mensais para os indicadores Top 5* monthly market expectations top 5's top5s-annual: refers API *Expectativas de mercado anuais para os indicadores Top 5* annual market expectations top 5's indic argument must one indicators listed Details. Respecting case, blank spaces accents. ... used API's parameters. $top specify maximum number rows returned, returns $top rows, chronological order. $skip can used ignore first rows. provided $filter applies filters according <https://olinda.bcb.gov.br/olinda/servico/ajuda>.

title: Get market expectations — get_market_expectations
text: data.frame requested data.

title: Get market expectations — get_market_expectations
text: statistics computed based expectations provided many financial institutions Brazil: banks, funds, risk managers, forth. expections statistics used build FOCUS Report weekly released Brazilian Central Bank. market expectations available following indicators: Balança Comercial Câmbio Conta corrente Dívida bruta governo geral Dívida líquida setor público IGP-DI IGP-M INPC Investimento direto país IPA-DI IPA-M IPCA IPCA Administrados IPCA Alimentação domicílio IPCA Bens industrializados IPCA Livres IPCA Serviços IPCA-15 IPC-FIPE PIB Agropecuária PIB Despesa de consumo da administração pública PIB despesa de consumo das famílias PIB Exportação de bens e serviços PIB Formação Bruta de Capital Fixo PIB Importação de bens e serviços PIB Indústria PIB Serviços PIB Total Produção industrial Resultado nominal Resultado primário Selic Taxa de desocupação Check <https://olinda.bcb.gov.br/olinda/servico/Expectativas/versao/v1/documentacao> details

title: Get market expectations — get_market_expectations
code: if (FALSE) { indic <- c("IPCA", "Câmbio") x <- get_market_expectations("annual", indic, `$top` = 10)  x <- get_market_expectations("monthly", "Selic", `$top` = 20)  # get monthly expectations for top 5 indicators since 2021 x <- get_market_expectations("top5s-monthly", start_date = "2021-01-01")  # get annual expectations for top 5 indicators since 2021 x <- get_market_expectations("top5s-annual", `$top` = 20)  # get all inflation expectations for 12 months ahead starting on 2021-01 x <- get_market_expectations("inflation-12-months", start_date = "2021-01-01")  # get all SELIC expectations informed by financial institutions since 2022 x <- get_market_expectations("selic", start_date = "2022-01-01")  # get TOP5 SELIC expectations starting on 2022 x <- get_market_expectations("top5s-selic", start_date = "2022-01-01") }

what: Get the series from BCB — get_series
title: Get the series from BCB — get_series
text: Get series BCB

title: Get the series from BCB — get_series
code: get_series(   code,   start_date = NULL,   end_date = NULL,   last = 0,   as = c("tibble", "xts", "ts", "data.frame", "text") )

title: Get the series from BCB — get_series
text: code series code start_date series initial date. Accepts ISO character formated date Date. end_date series final date. Accepts ISO character formated date Date. last last items series returning type: data objects (tibble, xts, data.frame, ts) text raw JSON code argument can obtained SGS system site. site searches can executed order find desired series use series code code argument. arguments start_date, end_date last optional. none arguments set, entire time series downloaded. Define start_date end_date download period data download last N registers define last argument N positive integer. last provided overrides arguments start_date end_date.

title: Get the series from BCB — get_series
text: tibble default returning class, argument can set xts, data.frame, ts, text return types. text returns JSON data provided remote API.

title: Get the series from BCB — get_series
code: # download the entire series if (FALSE) { get_series(1) } # download a period of dates if (FALSE) { get_series(1, start_date = "2016-12-01") } if (FALSE) { x <- get_series(1, start_date = "2016-12-01", end_date = "2016-12-31") } # downlaod the last register if (FALSE) { x <- get_series(1, last = 1) }

what: Get inflation's market expectations for the next 12 months — get_twelve_months_inflation_expectations
title: Get inflation's market expectations for the next 12 months — get_twelve_months_inflation_expectations
text: Statistics inflation's market expectations next 12 months. statistics computed based expectations provided many financial institutions Brazil: banks, funds, risk managers, forth. expections statistics used build FOCUS Report weekly released Brazilian Central Bank.

title: Get inflation's market expectations for the next 12 months — get_twelve_months_inflation_expectations
code: get_twelve_months_inflation_expectations(   indic = NULL,   start_date = NULL,   end_date = NULL,   ... )

title: Get inflation's market expectations for the next 12 months — get_twelve_months_inflation_expectations
text: indic character vector economic indicators names. case sensitive forget accents. start_date series initial date. Accepts ISO character formated date Date. end_date series final date. Accepts ISO character formated date Date. ... additional parameters passed API indic argument must one indicators listed Details. Respecting case, blank spaces accents. ... used API's parameters. $top specify maximum number rows returned, returns $top rows, chronological order. also $skip ignore first rows.

title: Get inflation's market expectations for the next 12 months — get_twelve_months_inflation_expectations
text: data.frame requested data.

title: Get inflation's market expectations for the next 12 months — get_twelve_months_inflation_expectations
text: inflation's expectations available following indicators: IGP-DI IGP-M INPC IPA-DI IPA-M IPCA IPCA Administrados IPCA Alimentação domicílio IPCA Bens industrializados IPCA Livres IPCA Serviços IPCA-15 IPC-FIPE Check <https://olinda.bcb.gov.br/olinda/servico/Expectativas/versao/v1/documentacao#ExpectativasMercadoInflacao12Meses> details

title: Get inflation's market expectations for the next 12 months — get_twelve_months_inflation_expectations
code: if (FALSE) { indic <- c("IPCA", "IGP-M") end_date <- "2018-06-22" x <- get_twelve_months_inflation_expectations(indic, end_date = end_date, `$top` = 10)  # return all indicators for the specified date range start_date <- "2021-01-01" x <- get_twelve_months_inflation_expectations(start_date = start_date, `$top` = 20) }

what: Helpers to access time series columns — helpers
title: Helpers to access time series columns — helpers
text: Extraxt bid ask data time series objects.

title: Helpers to access time series columns — helpers
code: Bid(x, ...)  # S3 method for data.frame Bid(x, ...)  # S3 method for xts Bid(x, ...)  # S3 method for olinda_df Bid(x, ...)  Ask(x, ...)  # S3 method for data.frame Ask(x, ...)  # S3 method for xts Ask(x, ...)  # S3 method for olinda_df Ask(x, ...)

title: Helpers to access time series columns — helpers
text: x time series objects containing data extracted ... additional arguments

title: Helpers to access time series columns — helpers
text: tibble time series

title: Helpers to access time series columns — helpers
code: if (FALSE) { x <- get_currency("EUR", "2018-06-22", "2018-06-28") Bid(x) Ask(x) }

title: List all currencies — list_currencies
text: Lists currencies presents name, symbol, numeric code, country name county numeric code

title: List all currencies — list_currencies
code: list_currencies()

title: List all currencies — list_currencies
text: data.frame information currencies

title: List all currencies — list_currencies
code: if (FALSE) { list_currencies() }

what: Get currency values for a given period — olinda_get_currency
title: Get currency values for a given period — olinda_get_currency
text: Given currency symbol time interval (dates) function returns bid ask time series currency rates.

title: Get currency values for a given period — olinda_get_currency
code: olinda_get_currency(   symbol,   start_date,   end_date = NULL,   as = c("tibble", "xts", "data.frame", "text"),   parity = FALSE )

title: Get currency values for a given period — olinda_get_currency
text: symbol currency symbol start_date time interval initial date end_date time interval last date object's returning type parity TRUE returns parity quotation (default FALSE currency quoted BRL) symbol argument three digits character represents one currency. symbols can obtained list_currencies. time series date range defined start_date end_date. end_date passed, set equals start_date. parity argument defaults FALSE, means returned data quoted BRL. TRUE returned data quoted USD, type currencies type B currencies quoted 1 USD CURRENCY. example, AUD, type B, returns 1 USD AUD.

title: Get currency values for a given period — olinda_get_currency
text: time series bid ask currency rates regarding given symbol quoted BRL. default returning tibble-fashioned data.frame three columns: date, ask bid. argument also accepts data.frame return old fashioned data frames, xts return xts object two variables (bid ask) text returns text content download BCB site.

title: Get currency values for a given period — olinda_get_currency
code: if (FALSE) { olinda_get_currency("USD", "2017-03-01", "2017-03-10") }

title: List all currencies — olinda_list_currencies
text: Lists currencies presents name, symbol, numeric code, country name county numeric code

title: List all currencies — olinda_list_currencies
code: olinda_list_currencies()

title: List all currencies — olinda_list_currencies
text: data.frame information currencies. currency_type refers currency's parity quotation. Parity quotations relates currency values USD.

title: List all currencies — olinda_list_currencies
code: if (FALSE) { list_currencies() }

title: rbcb options — rbcb-options
text: Options used rbcb inside functions.

title: rbcb options — rbcb-options
text: * `rbcb_cache`: downloaded data stored temporary directories,   `rbcb_cache` FALSE downloaded data overwrites files already   exists. Otherwise, download executed existing file   returned. Defaults TRUE. * `rbcb_verbose`: TRUE verbose messages displayed http requests   executed httr. Defaults FALSE.

title: rbcb options — rbcb-options
code: if (FALSE) { options(rbcb_cache = FALSE) options(rbcb_verbose = TRUE) }

what: rbcb: R Interface to Brazilian Central Bank Web Services — rbcb-package
title: rbcb: R Interface to Brazilian Central Bank Web Services — rbcb-package
text: Brazilian Central Bank API delivers many datasets regard economic activity, regional economy, international economy, public finances, credit indicators many . information please see http://dadosabertos.bcb.gov.br/. datasets can accessed 'rbcb' functions can obtained different data structures common R ('tibble', 'data.frame', 'xts', ...). Brazilian Central Bank API delivers many datasets regard economic activity, regional economy, international economy, public finances, credit indicators many . datasets can accessed rbcb functions can obtained different data structures common R (tibble, data.frame, xts, ...).

title: rbcb dataset — rbcb_dataset
text: `rbcb_dataset(name)` opens [RStudio   gadget](https://shiny.rstudio.com/articles/gadgets.html)   [addin](http://rstudio.github.io/rstudioaddins/) allows view   attributes help explain desired data.

title: rbcb dataset — rbcb_dataset
code: rbcb_dataset(name)

title: rbcb dataset — rbcb_dataset
text: name dataset name

title: rbcb dataset — rbcb_dataset
text: Addin return

what: Gets data from BCB open data services — rbcb_get
title: Gets data from BCB open data services — rbcb_get
text: Gets SGS, currency, market expectations many datasets Brazilian Central Bank open data services.

title: Gets data from BCB open data services — rbcb_get
code: rbcb_get(x, ...)  # S3 method for sgs rbcb_get(x, from = NULL, to = NULL, last = 0, ...)

title: Gets data from BCB open data services — rbcb_get
text: x object represents kind data downloaded ... others arguments series initial date. Accepts ISO character formated date Date. series final date. Accepts ISO character formated date Date. last last items series use SGS API `sgs` object passed.

title: Gets data from BCB open data services — rbcb_get
text: dataset corresponding data (usually `tibble`)

title: Gets data from BCB open data services — rbcb_get
code: if (FALSE) { x <- sgs(USD = 1, SELIC = 1178) rbcb_get(x, from = Sys.Date() - 10) }

title: rbcb Search — rbcb_search
text: `rbcb_search(text)` opens [RStudio   gadget](https://shiny.rstudio.com/articles/gadgets.html)   [addin](http://rstudio.github.io/rstudioaddins/) allows query   specific terms see suitable rbcb command fetch   desired data.

title: rbcb Search — rbcb_search
code: rbcb_search(text = "")

title: rbcb Search — rbcb_search
text: text text search

title: rbcb Search — rbcb_search
text: Addin return

title: Create SGS code — sgs
text: SGS code objects represents SGS code used download datasets SGS API.

title: Create SGS code — sgs
code: sgs(..., load_info = TRUE)

title: Create SGS code — sgs
text: ... numeric codes (preferably named) load_info `logical` indicating dataset info shoud loaded (default TRUE)

title: Create SGS code — sgs
text: SGS object representing SGS codes

title: Create SGS code — sgs
code: if (FALSE) { sgs(USD = 1, IPCA = 433) }

what: Convert tidy dataframe into a list — sgs_untidy
title: Convert tidy dataframe into a list — sgs_untidy
text: Convert tidy dataframe list separate time series objects like `xts` `ts` even `tibble` time series representation ( two columns dates values).

title: Convert tidy dataframe into a list — sgs_untidy
code: sgs_untidy(x, tidydf, as = c("tibble", "xts", "ts"))

title: Convert tidy dataframe into a list — sgs_untidy
text: x sgs object corresponding codes tidydf tidy dataframe returned `rbcb_get` returning type (`tibble`, `xts`, `ts`)

title: Convert tidy dataframe into a list — sgs_untidy
text: list time series objects

title: Convert tidy dataframe into a list — sgs_untidy
code: if (FALSE) { x <- sgs(USD = 1, SELIC = 1178) df <- rbcb_get(x, from = Sys.Date() - 10) sgs_untidy(x, df, as = "xts") }

title: rbcb 0.1.11
text: created documentation site pkgdown rbcb_get implemented SGS API, used infrastruture get_series (Issue #17) new function sgs_untidy convert tidy dataframes returned rbcb_get xts ts objects NAMESPACE organized (use importFrom instead import NAMESPACE) upgraded tests testthat 3 tests improve coverage implemented cache system (thru options) (Issue #54) new functions access datasets API

title: rbcb 0.1.10
text: CRAN release: 2022-03-30 added new Selic endpoints market expectations API: get_selic_market_expectations get_top5s_selic_market_expectations. Added NEWS.md file track changes package.

title: rbcb 0.1.9
text: CRAN release: 2022-02-24 added skip_on_cran tests need connectivity added load_info argument series_obj function enable/disable series information loading

title: rbcb 0.1.8
text: CRAN release: 2022-01-30 added skip_on_cran tests need connectivity added \dontrun examples need connectivity

title: rbcb 0.1.7
text: CRAN release: 2022-01-10 new market expectations function: get_market_expectations new API exchange rates using olinda API new addins: rbcb_search, rbcb_dataset

title: rbcb 0.1.6
text: solved bug downloading market expectations (issue #28) added new columns market expectations API calls (issue #26)

title: rbcb 0.1.5
text: CRAN release: 2018-06-30 implemented functions get market expectations data: get_twelve_months_inflation_expectations, get_top5s_annual_market_expectations, get_top5s_monthly_market_expectations implemented helpers extract data bid ask columns currency time series (issue #21)

title: rbcb 0.1.4
text: CRAN release: 2018-06-01 implemented functions get market expectations data: get_monthly_market_expectations, get_quarterly_market_expectations, get_annual_market_expectations implemented workaround solve BUG duplicated currencies PTAX form (issue #19)

title: rbcb 0.1.3
text: CRAN release: 2018-03-03 implemented new naming style get_series (issue #9) implemented fetch multiple series one get_series call (issue #11) removed get_series ts_options argument, now uses series info define frequency start

title: rbcb 0.1.2
text: CRAN release: 2017-11-19 added User-Agent header http requests implemented ts return get_series (issue #5) changed search URL (issue #7)

title: rbcb 0.1.1
text: CRAN release: 2017-05-24 set default values get_series make API arguments optional

title: rbcb 0.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2017-03-22 first functional release
